QuestTask_foodTruck_1_donate_almondmuffi: I need some almond muffins to create an enticing smell - and hopefully pass Oleg's taste test
Donate almond muffins from the bakery
QuestTask_foodTruck_1_donate_peaches_cop: I'm pretty sure George once recommended peach juice for healthy skin. What a great way to trick them into something healthy, but first - peaches!
QuestTask_foodTruck_1_donate_peaches_tit: Son of a Peacher Man I
QuestTask_foodTruck_1_harvest_cardboardc: Rats, another thing I forgot! They can't drink out of their hands... can they? No, no, we need cups.
You can find cardboard cups when harvesting and producing on your gourmet farm
Son of a Peacher Man II
QuestTask_foodTruck_2_donate_barley_copy: What do I make though? A healthy Apple twist! I will need barley for some healthy dough.
QuestTask_foodTruck_2_donate_barley_help: Donate some barley for the dough
QuestTask_foodTruck_2_donate_bluefish_co: Time to call in that fishy favour! I think some bluefish will do quite nicely.
QuestTask_foodTruck_2_donate_bluefish_he: Catch, or have Oleg catch, and donate some bluefish
QuestTask_foodTruck_2_donate_egg_copy: Ok, last thing I need for the dough is some eggs.
QuestTask_foodTruck_2_donate_egg_help: Donate the eggs needed for the dough
QuestTask_foodTruck_3_donate_appleturnov: Apple Turnovers from Apple's van, how can they resist? And it's perfectly wrapped for travelers on the trot.
Produce and donate some apple turnovers from the bakery
QuestTask_foodTruck_3_donate_cherry_copy: Let's make this Apple twist a cherry twist! I'll add a sweet cherry glaze for that unique taste.
QuestTask_foodTruck_3_donate_cherry_help: Produce and donate cherries from the main farm
QuestTask_foodTruck_4_donate_donkey_copy: Is that a donkey stable I see? Maybe I can enlist some help if I can convince them to move...
QuestTask_foodTruck_4_harvest_applepie_c: Donkeys sure are slow! I guess while I wait for them to move their keister I can make something for our customers. Apple pie sounds good to me.
QuestTask_foodTruck_4_harvest_applepie_h: Produce apple pie in your bakery on the gourmet farm.
QuestTask_foodTruck_4_harvest_carrot_cop: Still being stubborn huh? Maybe I can convince you with some produce. Maybe I'll use carrots, that way I can hold one end and not get my fingers bitten off!
QuestTask_foodTruck_4_harvest_carrot_hel: You can find carrots when harvesting and producing on your gourmet farm
QuestTask_foodTruck_5_donate_almonds_cop: Some nuts would be good to enhance the crunch and add some healthy fat.
QuestTask_foodTruck_5_donate_dandelion_c: This dish needs an Apple twist! Some fresh dandelion would look great and add subtle flavour.
QuestTask_foodTruck_5_donate_lambslettuc: First we need a base for the salad, something light with a bit of crunch to it.
Produce and donate some lamb's lettuce
QuestTask_foodTruck_6_harvest_milk_copy: My old Ma used to put milk on bug bites to soothe them, always worked a treat when I was young. Perhaps that will soothe them long enough for me to finish up.
QuestTask_foodTruck_6_harvest_milk_help: Produce milk in your cowshed or goat stable.
QuestTask_foodTruck_6_harvest_serviette_: Some of our recipes can get a bit messy, I think our crowd would like something to clean their hands with.
QuestTask_friendInvite1_inviteFriend_cop: Games are more fun with friends!
QuestTask_friendInvite1_inviteFriend_hel: The more, the merrier! A new building at your airport has been unlocked. There you can invite your friends and see the progress they have made in the game. You'll also get rewards once they achieve certain goals.
QuestTask_horsePaddock1_6_1_ownObject_ho: Nothing would go better in this stylish new stall than a new horse...
Upgrading takes time and costs competition horseshoes, but every upgrade level lets you house one more horse in your stable.
QuestTask_horsePaddock1_donate_HorseShoe: The people in the village said there's a captain here with horseshoes on board? Crazy stuff!
Help Captain Barnacle to complete the load of cargo for his ship. In return, you'll get horseshoes that you can use to unlock the horse ranch.
QuestTask_horsePaddock2_1_1_haveHorseRar: Many horse breeds are refined by pairing them with Arabian and Thoroughbred horses.
Your horse needs to have a high breeding value for the breeding quality level to increase during breeding. This breeding value comes from averaging your horse's training levels.
Have 1 horse with breeding quality level {0}
QuestTask_horsePaddock2_6_1_ownObject_ho: Along with plenty of chances for our horses to feel the wind in their manes, we'll also be able to offer the animals a bright stable with lots of room.
Upgrading takes time and costs competition horseshoes, but every upgrade level lets you house one more horse in your stable.
QuestTask_horsePaddock2_6_collectItem_Ho: Dressage, show jumping, or racing - which discipline will you choose?
QuestTask_horsePaddock2_clientAction_24_: Goldy used to be a wild horse. Try to avoid any sudden movements – they could startle the animal.
The stable is located to the north of the ranch. Use the ring menu to enter the stable.
QuestTask_horsePaddock2_clientAction_25_: I think you're getting along just fine. How about a new name for your little one?
Enter the stable and click on the button next to the horse's name to give it a new name.

Complete a session of endurance training
QuestTask_horsePaddock3_2_finishTraining: Change of direction, halt, and rein-back are basics you'll need for dressage later on.

QuestTask_horsePaddock3_3_finishTraining: Have you also checked if your saddle fits snugly?

QuestTask_horsePaddock4_1_1_ownObject_tr: You can train your horse's endurance here.

QuestTask_horsePaddock4_1_2_ownObject_tr: Did you know that horse racing is one of the oldest sports in the world?

QuestTask_horsePaddock4_2_1_ownObject_tr: Longeing is a technique that teaches horses to move smoothly in a circle. By the way, it's a great warm-up exercise.

QuestTask_horsePaddock4_2_2_ownObject_tr: A few gentle laps after every exercise help the horse to relax.

QuestTask_horsePaddock6_ownHorse_help: Open your stable's ring menu to see an overview of your horses or to use horseshoes to buy a second horse. You can house more horses in your stable by upgrading it. Each horse needs its own stall in the stable.

QuestTask_horsePaddock7_ownHorse_help: You can start breeding horses once they have a breeding value of 10 or higher. Train your horses to increase their breeding value. Intensive training costs more horseshoes, but you also get more training points for it.

QuestTask_horsePaddock8_breedHorse_copy: The better the parent horses are trained, the higher their breeding values become.
QuestTask_horsePaddock8_breedHorse_help: You can choose the parent horses you want to breed together in the stable. They each need to have a breeding value of 10 or higher. Breeding costs you horseshoes, and afterward the parents will no longer be available to you.

QuestTask_siloEventVisitQuest_startEvent: Meet Farmer George at the packaging station next to your farm and help him pack as many farm products as possible into boxes!
QuestTask_tropicalFarmAirport1_donate_Ce: I'm just so happy that you're helping my brother!
You obtain certificates by completing missions.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmAirport2_harvest_t: Even in a tiny paradise like this, you can't get by on everything without money.
Use the button for exchanging currency in the airport's ring menu to start the currency exchange.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmAirport3_clientAct: I think Johnny appreciates your help already!
Use the button in the airport's ring menu to go to the island farm.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que1Add1_ownOb: Pretty warm, huh? Did you know that people living in this climate zone avoid working during the middle of the day?
You can find the island fields in the Production Facilities tab of the construction menu. Building and upgrading cost island dollars.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que1Add2_ownOb: The palm trees here grow fast and provide high quality wood. We can use some to stabilize the mill.
Upgrading objects costs time and money, but offers lots of advantages. For example, upgrading can increase the capacity and also unlock new production processes.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que1Add3_harve: That sounds like quite a lot. And I think it actually is.
You can grow and harvest oranges in your island fields.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que1Add4_nameF: I could find some inspiration in my comic books if you don't have any ideas.
You can rename your farm using the options in the top right. The first name is free, but any later changes cost gold. Swear words are prohibited and may not be used.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que1_produce_t: A lot of work is ahead of us, but the effort will be worth it.
Orange Fizz requires oranges. You can start production in the beach bar once you have enough fruit in stock.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que2Add1_ownOb: A mango tree can grow up to 45 meters tall and its leaves smell of lilies. Truly sensational!
You can find the mango orchard in the Production Facilities tab of the construction menu.
Own 1 mango orchard level 1 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que2Add2_ownOb: Even so, I think they shouldn't get too used to us – they're still wild animals after all.
You can find the peacock coop in the Production Facilities tab of the construction menu.
Own 2 peacock coops level 1 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que2Add3_ownOb: This will make the bar stable enough so that it doesn't get blown away by the first gust of wind. And at this time of year there are a fair few of those.
Upgrading costs time and money, but the higher the upgrade level, the fewer ingredients you need for the cocktails.
Own a beach bar level 2 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que2_harvest_t: Although true beauty can only ever be seen by the heart, I have to admit that these are really gorgeous animals.
You can make peacock feed in the mill from peanuts.
If elephants lived here, they would surely be tempted by these.
You can grow peanuts in your island fields.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que3Add1_ownOb: In a silo like this, dung becomes valuable fertilizer all on its own – and we could definitely use some fertilizer here.
You can make fertilizer from dung in the silo. Fertilizer is needed to start production in orchards.
Own a silo level 2 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que3Add2_ownOb: Once again, Mother Nature comes to our aid, and we barely have to do anything ourselves.
You can find the composter in the Processing tab of the construction menu.
Own 1 composter level 1 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que3Add3_ownOb: Do you think it makes a difference what animals the fertilizer comes from?
Upgrading fields to higher levels increases their yield.
Own 2 fields level 2 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que3_harvest_t: Nature will provide everything we need!
Island fertilizer can be made in the silo on the island farm.
You should also be able to make humus from palm leaves, right?
Island humus can be made in the composter on the island farm.
Of course we need a ton of fruit in stock before we can start mixing.
Mangos grow in orchards on your island farm.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que4Add1_ownOb: The book also said that the trees grow much better when they're cut regularly.
Orchards upgraded to higher levels increase your harvest.
Own 2 mango orchards level 2 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que4Add2_ownOb: Their loud calls are interpreted by the locals as "minh-ao" and mean that bad weather is coming.
You can find peacock coops in the Production Facilities tab of the construction menu.
Own 4 peacock coops level 1 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que4_harvest_t: The key is getting the mix just right – have I already told you the perfect ratio?
Summer Slush requires oranges and mangos. You can start production in the beach bar once you have enough fruit in stock.
No one can get enough of these little vitamin bombs.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que5Add1_ownOb: Upgrading fields to higher levels increases their yield.
Own 5 fields level 2 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que5Add2_harve: I hope you know how to deal with their sharp beaks. We don't want them pecking at our fingers.
You can make peacock feed in the mill. The peanuts that you need to produce the feed grow in island fields.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que5_collectIt: Have I already told you what you can make from seashells?
You can sell your products for seashells in the event farm management panel.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha1Que5_harvest_t: What could these feathers be used for?
Use feed on a peacock coop to start production.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que1Add1_ownOb: Have I already told you what I learned from the cliff climbers in Asia?
You can find the lemur pen in the Production Facilities tab of the construction menu.
Have 1 lemur pen level 1 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que1Add2_ownOb: Isn't the circle of life fascinating? Stinking manure helps delicate little plants to flourish.
A bigger silo can process more dung at once. Upgrading it takes time and costs island dollars.
Own a silo level 3 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que1_harvest_t: I saw in a film that lemurs get on great with penguins.
Grapes grow in island fields. You can make them into lemur feed in the mill.
Peacocks love them! I wonder if the lemurs will too.
Peanuts grow in island fields. You can make them into peacock feed in the mill.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que2Add1_ownOb: We should also remember to break up the soil regularly. There aren't any moles here to do it for us, I think.
Upgrading fields to higher levels increases their yield.
Own 5 fields level 3 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que2Add2_ownOb: But if it's not a nut, then why isn't it called a cocofruit?
Orchards upgraded to higher levels increase your harvest.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que2_harvest_t: You should also collect the kernels – then we can plant more trees.
Use island fertilizer on an orchard on your island farm to start production.
Those little rascals have seriously sharp claws!
Summer Slush requires oranges and mangos. You can start production in the beach bar once you have enough fruit in stock.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que3Add1_ownOb: But don't cut too much off!
Upgraded production facilities significantly increase their yield.
Own 2 mango orchards level 3 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que3Add2_ownOb: Their eggs are roughly the same size as chicken eggs. Unbelievable how such big animals can grow from something so small.
Upgraded production facilities significantly increase their yield.
Have 5 peacock coops level 2 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que3Add3_ownOb: Look, our tropical mill is saying the same! But we should do a little more work before we take a break.
The tropical mill is needed for making grapes and peanuts from island fields into animal feed.
Upgrade the tropical mill to level 3
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que3_harvest_t: Sweet, fruity, exotic, and refreshing! A true masterpiece of nature, this fruit – er, nut.
Use island fertilizer on an orchard on your island farm to start production.
Let's calm the lemurs down with some feed. I've just seen yet another ringed tail in the barn.
Grapes grow in island fields. You can make them into lemur feed in the mill.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que4Add1_ownOb: These little pests are also known as tree cats around here, but they've certainly got sharp teeth for cats!
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
Have 2 lemur pens level 3 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que4Add2_ownOb: Since we're now producing organic fertilizer, it's okay if we make a bit more of it.
Island fertilizer can be made in the silo from dung. You need island fertilizer to start production in orchards on your island farm.
Own a silo level 4 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que4_harvest_t: People used to think they were demons because of their nocturnal activity and reflective eyes. They certainly terrorize my fruit supplies.
You can breed lemurs in the lemur pen. They need lemur feed, which is made from grapes in the tropical mill.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que4_produce_t: The coconut juice gives the cocktails a delicious, exotic flavor. Mmmm...
Fruity Flip requires oranges, mangos, and coconuts. You can start production in the beach bar once you have enough fruit in stock.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que5Add1_harve: That's definitely a pungent smell. Doesn't bother me, but what do our guests think?
You can get dung from stables on your island farm. You can process dung into island fertilizer in the silo.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que5Add2_ownOb: And the material for repairs is practically just lying around.
Upgrading costs time and money, but the higher the upgrade level, the fewer ingredients you need for the cocktails.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha2Que5_harvest_t: Just a second! What did I do with my sunglasses?
The silo makes dung into island fertilizer. It is used to fertilize orchards on your island farm.
I just love jumping into huuuge piles of leaves!
Tropical fallen leaves are a by-product of orchards on your island farm. They are used in the composter to produce island humus for cultivation areas.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que1Add1_ownOb: I hope the lemurs leave a few bananas for us!
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que1Add2_ownOb: I'll just quickly put my deckchair away.
Upgraded island fields significantly increase their yield.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que1Add3_ownOb: Do you mind if I build a tree house in one of these trees?
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que1_collectIt: In some regions, people don't use seashells as money, they actually string them together to make even more valuable necklaces.
You receive seashells by selling products through the event farm management panel.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que1_harvest_t: I think the world would be a much happier place if people exchanged resources, goods, or products instead of money.
You can breed peacocks in the peacock coop. They need peacock feed, which is made from peanuts in the tropical mill.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que2Add1_ownOb: Apparently it's doing okay, but we should keep an eye on it.
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que2Add2_ownOb: Did I tell you about the last huge storm? The locals are still talking about it.
Upgrading costs time and money, but the higher the upgrade level, the fewer ingredients you need for the cocktails.
Own 1 beach bar level 4 on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que2_harvest_t: Some people think they're silly, but I like cocktail umbrellas.
You can find coconuts in the orchards on your island farm.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que3Add1_ownOb: People say bananas taste best when you keep them in bright, warm conditions for four days.
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que3Add2_ownOb: Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que3_harvest_t: Now where did I put those funny ice cube trays?
Tropic Star requires oranges, mangos, coconuts, and bananas. You can start production in the beach bar once you have enough fruit in stock.
Now where have all the mangos gone?
Mangos grow in orchards on your island farm.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que4Add1_ownOb: If we want to keep the fruits, we should keep the little pests away from our stocks.
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que4_harvest_t: Even the locals get together at the bar for a few hours in the evenings and enjoy the last few rays of sunshine.
Bananas grow in orchards on your island farm.
You can get dung from stables on your island farm. You can process dung into island fertilizer in the silo.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que5Add1_ownOb: The peacocks need lots of space just to show their tail feathers.
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que5_collectIt: Seashells are actually home to little sea creatures, although they don't look like it. Some of them can live for more than 500 years!
You receive seashells by selling products through the event farm management panel.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que5_harvest_t: And make sure you stay laid-back.
Mangos grow in orchards on your island farm.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmCha3Que5_produce_t: I can't wait to taste our magnificent creation for the first time. By the way – where are the straws?
Tropic Star requires oranges, mangos, coconuts, and bananas. You can start production in the beach bar once you have enough fruit in stock.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmMoneyExchange_harv: Even in a tiny paradise like this, you can't get by on everything without money.
You can exchange currency in the island bank on the island farm.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmStart_visit_copy: I think Johnny appreciates your help already!
QuestTask_tropicalFarmStart_visit_help: Enter the island farm via the world map. Watch out for a tropical island.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmTutorial1_harvest_: Towards the end of spring, the orange trees on the island start to blossom and spread that wonderful smell everywhere.
You can grow and harvest oranges in your island fields.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmTutorial2_produce_: A little crushed ice and a straw, and it's ready!
Orange Fizz requires oranges. You can start production in the beach bar once you have enough fruit in stock.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmTutorial3_ownObjec: Still, it's a shady spot for hot days.
You can find houses in the Housing and Storage tab of the construction menu. Building and upgrading cost island dollars.
Own 1 house on your island farm
QuestTask_tropicalFarmTutorial4_expansio: By buying a farm expansion, you increase the amount of land on your island farm and gain new space to build on. Click on the space next to your island farm to buy an expansion.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmTutorial5_ownObjec: A mill like this one is a very practical invention. It'll mean a lot less work for us.
You can find the tropical mill in the Processing tab of the construction menu. Building and upgrading cost island dollars.
Have 1 tropical mill on your island farm.
QuestTask_tropicalFarmTutorial6_sellItem: I think we still have a few oranges in the store – maybe we could trade them for seashells.
Oranges grow on island fields and can be used in the beach bar or traded for seashells in the event farm management panel.
QuestTask_winNightFarmAirport1_donate_Ce: This proves your dedication and desire to help others. I like it!
You obtain certificates by completing missions.
QuestTask_winNightFarmAirport2_harvest_w: Even in the far north, you can't get by without money!
Use the button for exchanging currency in the airport's ring menu to start the currency exchange.
QuestTask_winNightFarmAirport3_clientAct: I wouldn't be able to stand the cold there in the long run!
Use the button in the airport's ring menu to go to the northern lights farm.
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que1Add1_ownOb: A little physical labor feels good in these temperatures. It gets you warm right away!
You can find the winter fields in the "Production facilities" tab of the construction menu. Building and upgrading cost snow dollars.
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que1Add2_ownOb: Tradition is all well and good, but we have to keep up with the times too. I know just the engineer for this... I'll call her straight away!
Upgrading objects costs time and money, but it also offers lots of advantages. For example, upgrading can increase capacity and let you produce new items.
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que1Add3_harve: You can grow and harvest flax in your winter fields.
If we all buckle down and get to it, we should be done in no time at all!
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que1Add4_nameF: It's completely up to you, but I think that something down-to-earth and Nordic would sound pretty cool.
You can rename your farm using the options in the top right. The first name is free, but any later changes cost gold. Swear words are prohibited and may not be used.
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que1_produce_w: You need flax for a viking tunic. If you have enough of this in your barn, you can start production in the viking workshop right away.
Start production of a stylish viking tunic
It's true that double stitches hold better! And quality has always been my recipe for success.
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que2Add1_ownOb: Even if we're not building our own longships, you can still use wood for all sorts of things!

Have 1 tree grove level 1 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que2Add2_ownOb: It feels good to do something positive for the environment and protect animals!
You can find the penguin pool in the "Production facilities" tab of the construction menu.
Have 2 penguin pools level 1 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que2Add3_ownOb: More size means more production! Our workers will love this spacious renovation too!
Upgrading costs time and money. But the higher the upgrade level, the fewer resources you need for producing viking gear.
Have 1 viking workshop level 2 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que2_harvest_w: You can make penguin feed in the mill using sardines.
You can breed sardines in your winter fields.
We should start building up a supply of sardines now. Who knows how hungry those little guys will be!
As a fisherman, I can tell you one thing for sure: it's really hard to get these wriggly little things into a bucket!
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que3Add1_ownOb: Sometimes I think it would be great if we could take advantage of the heat loss from the silo. But that's still a long way off.
In the silo you can make winter fertilizer from dung. Fertilizer is needed to start production in orchards, tree groves, and sheep pastures.
Have 1 silo level 2 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que3Add2_ownOb: This tank is a technological wonder. And I've heard that the vikings knew how to build one too.
You can find the algae tank in the "Processing" tab of the construction menu.
Have 1 algae tank level 1 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que3Add3_ownOb: Everything can thrive much better on fields that you've tended to well.
Upgrading fields to higher levels increases their yield.
Have 2 fields level 2 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que3_harvest_w: Winter fertilizer can be made in the silo on the northern lights farm.
Algae can be made in the algae tank on your northern lights farm.
Wood grows in tree groves on your northern lights farm.
Of course not everyone is fond of the smell, but processing dung into fertilizer is ultimately only to our benefit.
If we soak plant fibers in water for long enough, we should be able to make algae.
We can definitely use the wood as well as the plant debris that we get from growing and harvesting.
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que4Add1_ownOb: When I hear the north wind whistling through the trees, I wish I could have lived in the times of my ancestors.
Groves upgraded to higher levels increase your harvest.
Have 2 tree groves level 2 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que4Add2_ownOb: Even though they're not actually native to the north, these cute little guys feel right at home here.
You can find the penguin pool in the "Production facilities" tab of the construction menu.
Have 4 penguin pools level 1 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que4_harvest_w: You need flax and wood for a viking tankard. If you have enough of these in your barn, you can start production in the viking workshop right away.
We need a few thin strands made of durable natural fibers to make the tankards.
The vikings used to drink beer, mead, or sometimes even goat's milk from this kind of tankard. Whatever the occasion called for!
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que5Add1_ownOb: You can never have enough fields when your agricultural methods are as traditional as ours!
Upgrading fields to higher levels increases their yield.
Have 5 fields level 2 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que5Add2_harve: You can make penguin feed in the mill. It's made with sardines from your winter fields.
The high omega-3 content of our feed clearly stands the test: the penguins have shiny feathers and they always look so content.
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que5_collectIt: I can never get enough of these fascinating reminders of a rich past.
You can sell your products for runestones in the event farm management panel.
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha1Que5_harvest_w: I'm going to miss these amazing animals, but they belong in their natural habitat.
Use feed on a penguin pool to start production.
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que1Add1_ownOb: Would you have thought that seals can live as long as 30 to 35 years?
You can find the seal pond in the "Production facilities" tab of the construction menu.
Have 1 seal pond level 1 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que1Add2_ownOb: The better the fertilizer, the stronger the smell. That's just how it goes!

Have 1 silo level 3 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que1_harvest_w: You can breed herrings in the winter fields. They're made into seal feed in the mill.
You can breed sardines in the winter fields. They're made into penguin feed in the mill.
Did you know that there are 57 types of herring around the world? Amazing, don't you think?
Luckily we don't smother our sardines with oil and pack them into little tins. Otherwise we'd have to breed even more of these tiny fish!
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que2Add1_ownOb: Our soil is in excellent condition. See how good it is that we don't use artificial fertilizer here?
Upgrading fields to higher levels increases their yield.

QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que2Add2_ownOb: Be careful with those berries! You'll never get those red stains out of your shirt again.
Groves upgraded to higher levels increase your harvest.
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que2_harvest_w: You need flax and wood for a viking tankard. If you have enough of these in your barn, you can start production in the viking workshop right away.
Use winter fertilizer on a tree grove on your northern lights farm to start production.
I suspect that my ancestors rarely drank berry juice from these tankards.
When you knock on wood, the sound will tell you how seasoned it is. That's an old viking trick!
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que3Add1_ownOb: By expanding our groves, we're guaranteed to have enough wood in supply for quite a while again.
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
Have 2 tree groves level 3 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que3Add2_ownOb: Penguins are very curious! Watch that they don't steal anything out of your pockets when you go to their pool to feed them!
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
Have 5 penguin pools level 2 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que3Add3_ownOb: Our animals have incredible appetites. The mill has to be able to keep up of course!

Upgrade the stone mill to level 3
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que3_harvest_w: Use winter fertilizer on a berry orchard on your northern light farm to start production.
You can breed herrings in the winter fields. They're made into seal feed in the mill.
A perfectly ripe berry is truly delicious! But keep in mind: we need to have some left over to make dye.
I'm not a huge herring fan myself, but seals are totally crazy about them!
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que4Add1_ownOb: We need a bit more space to breed seals successfully. The mothers and baby animals need to have their alone time too.
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
Have 2 seal ponds level 3 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que4Add2_ownOb: Dealing with dung is like with anything else. Give it time and space, and it will become something useful like fertilizer.

Have 1 silo level 4 on your northern lights farm
QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que4_harvest_w: You can breed seals in the seal pond. They need seal feed, which is made using herrings in the stone mill.

QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que4_produce_w: You need flax, wood, and berries for a viking helmet. If you have enough of these in your barn, you can start production in the viking workshop right away.

QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que5Add1_harve: You can get dung from the pools and ponds on your northern lights farm. You can process dung into winter fertilizer in the silo.

QuestTask_winNightFarmCha2Que5Add2_ownOb: If we design our working space to be a bit more ergonomic, everything should be a piece of cake.
Upgrading costs time and money. But the higher the upgrade level, the fewer resources you need for producing viking gear.

You can get dung from the pools and ponds on your viking farm. You can process dung into winter fertilizer in the silo.
When sheep are freshly shorn, they always look like they got shrunk in the wash.
You can get sheep wool from the sheep pasture on the viking farm.
QuestTask_winterFarmCha3Que5Add1_ownObje: Let's build some roomier accommodations before all of these little chicks decide to hatch!
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
QuestTask_winterFarmCha3Que5_collectItem: We could even start our own museum with all of the runestones we've been collecting!
You receive runestones by selling products in the event farm management panel.
QuestTask_winterFarmCha3Que5_harvest_win: Every time we harvest wood, I give it three knocks for good luck. That's very important for a business!
Wood grows in tree groves on your viking farm.
QuestTask_winterFarmCha3Que5_produce_win: It's just occurred to me that you still don't have one of our coats. We need to fix this as soon as possible!
You need flax, wood, berries, and sheep wool for a viking coat. If you have enough of these in your barn, you can start production in the viking workshop right away.
Start production of a cozy viking coat
QuestTask_winterFarmMoneyExchange_harves: Even in the far north, you can't get by without money!
You can exchange currency in the viking vault on the viking farm.
QuestTask_winterFarmStart_visit_copy: I wouldn't be able to stand the cold there in the long run!
QuestTask_winterFarmStart_visit_help: Enter the viking farm via the world map. Watch out for a snow-covered island.
QuestTask_winterFarmTutorial1_harvest_wi: Look at how the flax blooms sway in the wind! It's like we're floating on a shimmering sea of lilac.
You can grow and harvest flax in your winter fields.
QuestTask_winterFarmTutorial2_produce_wi: The spun flax fibers are woven and sewn into something both beautiful and warm!
Viking tunics are made from flax. If you have enough of this in your barn, you can start production in the viking workshop right away.
Start production of a stylish viking tunic
QuestTask_winterFarmTutorial3_ownObject_: Spare no expense on comfort! Only happy workers are good workers.
You can find houses in the Housing and Storage tab of the construction menu. Building and upgrading cost snow dollars.
Own 1 house on your viking farm
QuestTask_winterFarmTutorial4_expansions: Everyone can twiddle their thumbs. But our thumbs are green!
By buying a farm expansion, you increase the amount of land on your viking farm and gain new space to build on. Click on the space next to your viking farm to buy an expansion.
QuestTask_winterFarmTutorial5_ownObject_: We can use this mill to make our own animal feed. The investment will pay off, guaranteed!
You can find the stone mill in the Processing tab of the construction menu. Building and upgrading cost snow dollars.
Have 1 stone mill on your viking farm
QuestTask_winterFarmTutorial6_sellItem_w: We could definitely trade a few bundles of flax, right?
Flax grows in winter fields and can be processed in the viking workshop or traded for runestones in the event farm management panel.
QuestTask_xmasFarmAirport1_donate_Certif: This proves your dedication and desire to help others. I like it!
You obtain certificates by completing missions.
QuestTask_xmasFarmAirport2_harvest_winte: Even in the far north, you can't get by without money!
Use the button for exchanging currency in the airport's ring menu to start the currency exchange.
QuestTask_xmasFarmAirport3_clientAction_: I wouldn't be able to stand the cold there in the long run!
Use the button in the airport's ring menu to go to the festive farm.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que1Add1_ownObject: A little physical labor feels good in these temperatures. It gets you warm right away!
You can find the winter fields in the "Production facilities" tab of the construction menu. Building and upgrading cost snow dollars.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que1Add3_harvest_x: If we all buckle down and get to it, we should be done in no time at all!
You can grow and harvest red flax in your winter fields.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que1Add4_nameFarm_: It's completely up to you, but I think that something festive would sound quite nice.
You can rename your farm using the options in the top right. The first name is free, but any later changes cost gold. Swear words are prohibited and may not be used.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que1_produce_xmasF: It's true that double stitches hold better! And quality has always been my recipe for success.
You need red flax for a Santa hat. If you have enough of this in your barn, you can start production in the festive workshop right away.
Start production of a Santa hat
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que2Add1_ownObject: Fir tree wood is relatively light and pliable, and you can use it for everything...
You can find the fir tree grove in the Production Facilities tab of the construction menu.
Have 1 fir tree grove level 1 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que2Add2_ownObject: It feels good to do something positive for the environment and protect animals!
You can find the penguin pool in the "Production facilities" tab of the construction menu.
Have 2 penguin pools level 1 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que2Add3_ownObject: More size means more production! Our workers will love this spacious renovation too!
Upgrading costs time and money. But the higher the upgrade level, the fewer resources you need for producing holiday items.
Have 1 festive workshop level 2 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que3Add1_ownObject: Sometimes I think it would be great if we could take advantage of the heat loss from the silo. But that's still a long way off.
In the silo you can make winter fertilizer from dung. Fertilizer is needed to start production in orchards, tree groves, and sheep pastures.
Have 1 silo level 2 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que3Add2_ownObject: This tank is a technological wonder. Even Santa Claus has one.
You can find the algae tank in the "Processing" tab of the construction menu.
Have 1 algae tank level 1 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que3Add3_ownObject: Everything can thrive much better on fields that you've tended to well.
Upgrading fields to higher levels increases their yield.
Have 2 fields level 2 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que3_harvest_winte: Of course not everyone is fond of the smell, but processing dung into fertilizer is ultimately only to our benefit.
Winter fertilizer can be made in the silo on the festive farm.
If we soak plant fibers in water for long enough, we should be able to make algae.
Algae can be made in the algae tank on your festive farm.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que3_harvest_xmasF: We can definitely use the fir tree wood as well as the plant debris that we get from growing and harvesting.
Fir tree wood grows in the fir tree groves on your festive farm.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que4Add1_ownObject: When I hear the wind whistling through the treetops, I think back on my childhood. I often spent cold December days hiking through the woods searching for Santa's reindeer.
Groves upgraded to higher levels increase your harvest.
Have 2 fir tree groves level 2 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que4Add2_ownObject: Even though they're not actually native to the north, these cute little guys feel right at home here.
You can find the penguin pool in the "Production facilities" tab of the construction menu.
Have 4 penguin pools level 1 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que4_harvest_xmasF: We need a few thin strands of durable natural fibers to make the reindeer carvings.
Red flax grows in winter fields.
This type of holiday decoration is popular with children and adults alike.
You need red flax and fir tree wood for a reindeer carving. If you have enough of this in your barn, you can start production in the festive workshop right away.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha1Que5Add1_ownObject: You can never have enough fields when your agricultural methods are as traditional as ours!
Upgrading fields to higher levels increases their yield.
Own 5 fields level 2 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha2Que1Add1_ownObject: Would you have thought that seals can live as long as 30 to 35 years?
You can find the seal pond in the "Production facilities" tab of the construction menu.
Have 1 seal pond level 1 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha2Que1Add2_ownObject: The better the fertilizer, the stronger the smell. That's just how it goes!
A bigger silo can process more dung at once. Upgrading it takes time and costs snow dollars.
Have 1 silo level 3 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha2Que2Add1_ownObject: Our soil is in excellent condition. See how good it is that we don't use artificial fertilizer here?
Upgrading fields to higher levels increases their yield.
Own 5 fields level 3 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha2Que2_harvest_xmasF: When you knock on fir tree wood, the sound will tell you how seasoned it is. That's an old trick from Santa's workshop!
Use winter fertilizer on a fir tree grove on your festive farm to start production.
Do you think that Santa would like these reindeer carvings?
You need red flax and fir tree wood for a reindeer carving. If you have enough of this in your barn, you can start production in the festive workshop right away.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha2Que3Add1_ownObject: By expanding our groves, we're guaranteed to have enough wood in supply for quite a while again.
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
Have 2 fir tree groves level 3 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha2Que3Add2_ownObject: Penguins are very curious! Watch that they don't steal anything out of your pockets when you go to their pool to feed them!
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
Have 5 penguin pools level 2 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha2Que4Add1_ownObject: We need a bit more space to breed seals successfully. The mothers and baby animals need to have their alone time too.
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
Have 2 seal ponds level 3 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha2Que4Add2_ownObject: Dealing with dung is like with anything else. Give it time and space, and it will become something useful like fertilizer.
Winter fertilizer can be made in the silo from dung. You need winter fertilizer to start production in orchards, tree groves, and sheep pastures on your winter farm.
Have 1 silo level 4 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha2Que4_harvest_winte: Seals are great jugglers! Keep an eye on their empty food bowls or they'll start balancing them on their noses!
You can breed seals in the seal pond. They need seal feed, which is made using herrings in the stone mill.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha2Que4_produce_xmasF: These joyful and colorful wreaths welcome visitors to every door. What a beautiful tradition!
You need red flax, fir tree wood, and berries for a holly wreath. If you have enough of this in your barn, you can start production in the festive workshop right away.
Start production of a holly wreath
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha2Que5Add1_harvest_w: When collecting dung, you need to at least wear gloves and a nose clip. That helps!
You can get dung from the pools and ponds on your festive farm. You can process dung into winter fertilizer in the silo.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha2Que5Add2_ownObject: If we design our working space to be a bit more ergonomic, everything should be a piece of cake.
Upgrading costs time and money. But the higher the upgrade level, the fewer resources you need for producing holiday items.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que1Add1_ownObject: I think that I'll give one of the sheep a name... How do you feel about Shaun?
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que1Add2_ownObject: If only the earth wasn't so hard... but that's probably due to the cold here.
Upgrading winter fields significantly increases their yield.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que1Add3_ownObject: The light rustling of leaves, the crisp fresh air... I could stay here forever.
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que1_collectItem_t: I'm starting to think that these stones used to be a type of currency.
You receive runestones by selling products in the event farm management panel.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que1_harvest_winte: They look a bit clumsy on land, but in the water they can zip off like tiny torpedoes.
You can breed penguins in the penguin pool. They need penguin feed, which is made using sardines in the stone mill.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que2Add2_ownObject: I think that this upgrade will boost our efficiency again!
Upgrading costs time and money. But the higher the upgrade level, the fewer resources you need for producing holiday items.
Have 1 festive workshop level 4 on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que2_harvest_winte: They're definitely delicious, and we shouldn't forget the dye! But harvesting them is awfully hard.
You can find berries in the berry orchards on your festive farm.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que3Add1_ownObject: Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que3_harvest_xmasF: We're already in need of more material for reindeer carvings and holly wreaths. That shouldn't be a problem anymore, though!
Fir tree wood grows in the fir tree groves on your festive farm.
Gorgeously decorated with a timeless design and evergreen scent ... These little trees will be a best seller!
You need red flax, fir tree wood, berries, and dyed wool for a Christmas tree. If you have enough of this in your barn, you can start production in the festive workshop right away.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que4Add1_ownObject: The grass in our pastures must be very nutritious. The sheep wool is strong and has a really nice shine.
Upgrading production facilities significantly increases their yield.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que4_harvest_winte: Did you forget your nose clip? Then try to breathe through your mouth.
You can get dung from the pools and ponds on your festive farm. You can process dung into winter fertilizer in the silo.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que4_harvest_xmasF: When sheep are freshly shorn, they always look like they got shrunk in the wash.
You can get dyed wool from the sheep pasture on the festive farm.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que5_collectItem_t: We could start our own museum with all the runestones we've been collecting!
You receive runestones by selling products in the event farm management panel.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que5_harvest_xmasF: Every time we harvest wood, I give it three knocks for good luck. That's very important for a business, especially during the holidays!
Fir tree wood grows in the fir tree groves on your festive farm.
QuestTask_xmasFarmCha3Que5_produce_xmasF: I've just noticed that you still don't have a Christmas tree! We have to fix that as soon as possible. I'd also like to give one to each of the farm workers!
You need red flax, fir tree wood, berries, and dyed wool for a Christmas tree. If you have enough of this in your barn, you can start production in the festive workshop right away.
Start production of a Christmas tree
QuestTask_xmasFarmMoneyExchange_harvest_: Even in the far north, you can't get by without money!
You can exchange currency in the festive bank on the festive farm.
QuestTask_xmasFarmStart_visit_copy: I wouldn't be able to stand the cold there in the long run!
QuestTask_xmasFarmStart_visit_help: Enter the festive farm via the world map. Watch out for a snow-covered island.
QuestTask_xmasFarmTutorial1_harvest_xmas: Look at how the flax blooms sway in the wind! It's like we're floating on a shimmering crimson sea.
You can grow and harvest red flax in your winter fields.
QuestTask_xmasFarmTutorial2_produce_xmas: The spun flax fibers are woven and sewn into something both beautiful and warm!
Santa hats are made from red flax. If you have enough of this in your barn, you can start production in the festive workshop right away.
QuestTask_xmasFarmTutorial3_ownObject_co: Spare no expense on comfort! Only happy workers are good workers.
QuestTask_xmasFarmTutorial3_ownObject_he: You can find houses in the "Housing and storage" tab of the construction menu. Building and upgrading cost snow dollars.
QuestTask_xmasFarmTutorial3_ownObject_ti: Own 1 house on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmTutorial4_expansions_c: Everyone can twiddle their thumbs. But our thumbs are green!
QuestTask_xmasFarmTutorial4_expansions_h: By buying a farm expansion you increase the amount of land on your festive farm and gain new space to build on. Click on the space next to your festive farm to buy an expansion.
QuestTask_xmasFarmTutorial5_ownObject_wi: We can use this mill to make our own animal feed. The investment will pay off, guaranteed!
You can find the stone mill in the "Processing" tab of the construction menu. Building and upgrading cost snow dollars.
Have 1 stone mill on your festive farm
QuestTask_xmasFarmTutorial6_sellItem_xma: We could definitely trade a few bundles of red flax, right?
Red flax grows in winter fields and can be processed in the festive workshop or traded for runestones in the event farm management panel.
QuestText_BennyHawaii_ThemeHawaii_2_harv: Do the chickens know they can't hatch coconuts?!
Coconuts can be found when harvesting and producing on your main farm.
QuestText_BennyHawaii_ThemeHawaii_3_dona: I can't believe Lana's turtle ate my shopping list ... Your cows are my heroes!
QuestText_BennyHawaii_ThemeHawaii_5_harv: Quick! Shelly is eagerly eyeing the fruits we've collected!
Lana, leave some cherries for the pie!
QuestText_DanielAsian_ThemeAsian_1_harve: Cause and effect - it's simple: a lot of fertilizer ensures especially bountiful blossoms!
QuestText_DanielAsian_ThemeAsian_1_produ: The Japanese cherry tree bears lots of blossoms but no fruit. We'll get that right with our apple trees!
QuestText_DanielAsian_ThemeAsian_2_harve: You can find Japanese ink wash paintings when collecting from the fields and stables on your main farm.
My dad had drawings like that in his office, too.
QuestText_DanielAsian_ThemeAsian_5_harve: Even if it doesn't work, the pigs will be squealing with joy.
QuestText_DanielAsian_ThemeAsian_6_harve: You can find origami cranes when harvesting and producing on your main farm.
The crane, a symbol of a long life, will hopefully help Takeshi to get better again soon.
QuestText_Daniel_Millstack_1_1_copy: Later, this will be the only way we'll be able to keep up with the high demand for feed.
QuestText_Daniel_Millstack_1_1_help: You can use the plus and minus buttons in the mill to determine how much feed to produce. The production time will vary accordingly.
QuestText_Daniel_Millstack_1_1_title: Begin a production of {0} chicken feed
QuestText_Daniel_Story1_4_donate_copy: I have a good feeling about this investment. Peter seems to have overcome his fear of birds.
QuestText_Daniel_Story1_4_earn_copy: It should be easy for you to make the little extra cash. It's not like it's much by your standards any more.
QuestText_Daniel_Story3_1_buyItem_copy: Let's see how Bob's piglets are doing. My handbook says we've done everything right.
QuestText_Daniel_Story3_2_harvest_copy: In college, I learned that pigs are especially profitable if we add natural supplements to their feed.
QuestText_Daniel_Story4_2_donate1_copy: I read that corn is one of the most popular vegetables for kids. Probably because it tastes so sweet.
QuestText_Daniel_Story4_2_donate2_copy: Hey diddle diddle, the cat and the fiddle, the cow jumped over the moon, the little dog laughed to see such fun, and the dish ran away with the spoon.
QuestText_Daniel_Story6_1_donate1_copy: The tests show that our chicken feed is of superior quality. The fish will devour it.
QuestText_Daniel_Story6_1_donate2_copy: A little fresh milk helps to keep the sauce creamy. If you add milk regularly, it will also prevent the fish from drying out in the oven.
QuestText_Daniel_Story6_1_donate3_copy: I'd never have thought that apples would go so well with fish. I'll ask for the recipe.
QuestText_Daniel_Story7_3_donate_copy: I see it as an investment in a business partnership. Let's see what it will bring.
QuestText_Daniel_Story7_3_produce_copy: Your mill is sturdy and should be able to manage it. I wouldn't see why not.
QuestText_Daniel_Story8_5_donate1_copy: Pure, untreated milk. Tastes great with cornflakes, too.
QuestText_Daniel_Story8_5_donate2_copy: Our corn is organic and good for you! No genetic engineering at all.
QuestText_Daniel_Story8_5_donate3_copy: Normally chicks hatch from eggs, don't they? But there aren't any chicks in those, are there?
QuestText_Daniel_Story9_3_buildMill_copy: Well, I can see you certainly managed to get Matilda's farm up and running.
QuestText_Daniel_assignWorkers_copy: Having good staff is everything if you want to get ahead.
QuestText_Daniel_boostProduction_copy: The best for this purpose, according to McDowning's book.
QuestText_Daniel_buyItem_copy: Is there anything better than boosting the economy?
QuestText_Daniel_construct_copy: Build and thrive, it's the only way to success.
QuestText_Daniel_destroy_copy: Demolish to make way for new things.
QuestText_Daniel_donate_copy: You grow with your tasks. Otherwise you would just be stuck in one place.
QuestText_Daniel_earnCash_copy: Money makes the world go round. It would be nice if it were different.
QuestText_Daniel_earnReputation_copy: Tactical finesse and solid planning are what's needed here.
QuestText_Daniel_finishMissions_copy: Let's prove that we can do this.
QuestText_Daniel_harvestCash_copy: You've certainly earned this with all your hard work.
QuestText_Daniel_harvest_copy: Hard work comes at a price. And I'm willing to pay it.
QuestText_Daniel_ownObject_copy: This acquisition will be worth the money. We have big plans.
QuestText_Daniel_produce_copy: This is just the start. If we play our cards right, the sky's the limit.
QuestText_Daniel_sellItem_copy: A good product is the be-all and end-all when it comes to surviving in the free market.
QuestText_Daniel_spendCash_copy: The gross domestic product will be thankful.
QuestText_Daniel_upgrade_copy: It takes little time, little effort, and the benefits are huge – that's what I call efficiency!
QuestText_Daniel_useIngredient_copy: Quality is our highest priority - we don't want to scare away our customers.
QuestText_GeorgeFairytale_ThemeFairytale: You can find storybook pages when collecting from the stables on your main farm.
I hope we find them all in time.
QuestText_George_Mine1_1_harvestCash_cop: Just like in the good ol' days! Back during the gold rush, you saw all sorts of types out here searching for valuable nuggets.
QuestText_George_Mine1_1_harvestCash_hel: You'll need a regular mining license for this. You can find one while producing in your mill.
QuestText_George_Story1_1_harvest_copy: Of course, corn is the main ingredient in chicken feed. It always has been.
QuestText_George_Story1_1_produce_copy: The recipe for chicken feed has been in our family for generations. Don't reveal the secret ingredient!
QuestText_George_Story2_2_harvest_copy: I should have eaten more apples as a child ... maybe then I wouldn't have lost all my teeth by the time I was 30.
QuestText_George_Story2_2_produce_copy: Your own composter always produces the best humus. The stuff you can buy is garbage.
QuestText_George_Story3_3_useIngredient_: Yes indeed, you never know how fast the pigs will break through the fence.
QuestText_George_Story5_4_buyItem_copy: You could get more for your money back in the day. Even though there wasn't so much to be had.
QuestText_George_Story5_4_donate_copy: There are too many pigs on this farm for my liking. I'm sure they're up to something...
QuestText_George_Story6_5_donate_copy: I could swear that people used to be more generous. But let's wait and see what we can raise at the auction.
QuestText_George_Story6_5_harvest_copy: You handle the pigs. I'll stay over here ... at a safe distance.
QuestText_George_Story6_5_sell_copy: Have you loaded up all the pigs? Good! I'll just go to the bathroom quickly and then we can head to the auction.
QuestText_George_Story8_3_harvest1_copy: They're really enjoying it, but we were faster at collecting eggs when we were kids.
QuestText_George_Story8_3_harvest2_copy: Why so surprised? That's just where milk comes from.
QuestText_George_Story8_4_donate_copy: Try the good apples. That's what a real apple tastes like.
QuestText_George_Story8_4_harvest_copy: Looks like city kids like climbing, too. Don't fall out of the tree!
QuestText_George_Story8_4_use_copy: There's one thing you need to know about fertilizer: if it doesn't stink, it's not good fertilizer.
QuestText_George_assignWorkers_copy: These days you need help with everything. I used to do all of this myself, you know.
QuestText_George_boostProduction_copy: All these bells and whistles weren't necessary in my day.
QuestText_George_buyItem_copy: More of that newfangled modern stuff! Is it really necessary?
QuestText_George_construct_copy: This place needs spit and elbow grease. That's what it needs.
QuestText_George_destroy_copy: Let's see what we'll find after we've demolished this. I haven't seen my dog in a while.
QuestText_George_donate_copy: Back then we grew everything ourselves.
QuestText_George_earnCash_copy: Money isn't everything. Back then we didn't need more than one chicken, one cow, and a nice piece of land.
QuestText_George_earnReputation_copy: Reputation points? Are these some more of your fashionable knickknacks?
QuestText_George_harvestCash_copy: Mmm … that tastes better than I remember!
QuestText_George_harvest_copy: Today we have farmhands and equipment ... but what happened to good ol' elbow grease?
QuestText_George_nameFarm_copy: It should be personal, but we don't like bad language in these parts.
QuestText_George_ownObject_copy: In my day, it was normal to always have enough, but never too much.
QuestText_George_produce_copy: What ever became of my workshop? I used to make everything in there.
QuestText_George_sellItem_copy: I used to set up by the side of the road and sell lemonade and eggs with Betty Sue.
QuestText_George_spendCash_copy: A good cowshed, a good field ... if you don't have the basics, your milk won't be any good.
QuestText_George_useIngredient_copy: Organic, eco-friendly ... you didn't need labels like that when I was young. Everything was organic, even the grease for my beard.
QuestText_JackUfo_ThemeUfo_2_harvest_hel: You can find UFO parts when harvesting your fields and orchards on your main farm.
QuestText_JackUfo_ThemeUfo_2_harvest_ufo: Metal foil and rods made of a strange material - I wonder if the alien wanted to use them to phone home?
QuestText_JackUfo_ThemeUfo_4_harvest_evi: The answers are there. You just have to know where to look.
QuestText_JackUfo_ThemeUfo_4_harvest_hel: You can find evidence photos when collecting products from stables and processing buildings on your main farm.
QuestText_JimJackUfo_ThemeUfo_3_produce_: You should keep an eye on your cowshed!
QuestText_JimJackUfo_ThemeUfo_6_harvest_: I actually always thought that a real alien hovers instead of leaving such big footprints behind.
You can find strange tracks when harvesting and producing on your main farm.
QuestText_JimUfo_ThemeUfo_1_harvest_corn: Have you asked yourself what aliens actually eat? I wonder if they like popcorn?
QuestText_JimUfo_ThemeUfo_5_harvest_appl: We can definitely stop the UFO with Jack's slingshot and enough ammunition!
QuestText_LanaHawaii_ThemeHawaii_1_harve: It sounds like a lot, but Shelly is very picky when it comes to food.
QuestText_LanaHawaii_ThemeHawaii_4_harve: Seashells can be found when harvesting fields and orchards on your main farm.
Ha, my revenge will be sweet! I'm good at kicking shins!
QuestText_LanaHawaii_ThemeHawaii_6_harve: The flower garlands are called leis, and sometimes we also use feathers, seashells, and leaves to craft them.
Flower blossoms can be found when harvesting and producing on your main farm.
QuestText_LesterFairytale_ThemeFairytale: And don't stray from the path … hehe!
QuestText_Lester_Story1_3_buy_copy: Looks like you're feeling particularly charitable today. Let's see how much longer your patience lasts.
QuestText_Lester_Story1_3_donate_copy: I don't give my feed to freeloaders. Everyone gets what they deserve!
QuestText_Lester_Story3_1_harvest_copy: Just be careful the pigs don't trot by and think that your cabbage is a welcome snack!
QuestText_Lester_Story4_3_donate1_copy: They want to stick some leaves and pressed flowers on paper and splash some color over them? How is that art?
QuestText_Lester_Story4_3_donate2_copy: It's a shame thinking about all that lovely money you would have made if you'd sold it.
QuestText_Lester_Story5_3_donate_copy: Do you know the fairy tale about Snow White and the apple ... you never know where you stand.
QuestText_Lester_Story7_2_harvest_copy: As you know, we often have to deal with beetle infestations in the fields. So be careful!
QuestText_Lester_boostProduction_copy: More, more, more! Greed is a cardinal sin, you say? What nonsense!
QuestText_Lester_buyItem_copy: It's a worthwhile acquisition for my ... I mean, your farm.
QuestText_Lester_construct_copy: I wouldn't put in too much effort. Who knows how much longer you'll be here?
QuestText_Lester_donate_copy: Charity is both a blessing and a curse.
QuestText_Lester_earnCash_copy: Money makes life so much easier.
QuestText_Lester_earnReputation_copy: Do you think everyone plays fair? I make use of every advantage.
QuestText_Lester_harvestCash_copy: It's a wonder that you make any profit at all with such low prices.
QuestText_Lester_harvest_copy: Yes, yes ... your farm does seem to be very fertile. I, er... you can do a lot with it.
QuestText_Lester_ownObject_copy: This one is a must for my ... um ... any farm.
QuestText_Lester_produce_copy: I like boosting my production by making my workers work overtime.
QuestText_Lester_sellItem_copy: We could invest the profits in new farm equipment.
QuestText_Lester_spendCash_copy: You reap what you sow. So don't be stingy with the seed.
QuestText_Lester_upgrade_copy: Upgrades are always worthwhile. Don't let me keep you.
QuestText_Lester_useIngredient_copy: You should check the composition very carefully ... we wouldn't want it to go wrong now, would we?
QuestText_Lilly_Story10_1_ownFarm_copy: Obviously, you can't own a piece of nature - but you can certainly use it!
QuestText_Lilly_Story10_2_nameFarm_copy: I'm convinced that a beautiful name will appeal to the benevolence of the spirits of nature.
QuestText_Lilly_Story10_3_produce_copy: The language of flowers is the most beautiful in the world because everybody understands it.
QuestText_Lilly_Story10_4_ownObject1_cop: Decorations are a delight each day, not only for the spirits of nature, but also for you!
QuestText_Lilly_Story10_4_ownObject2_cop: I love sleeping out in the open. A roof over my head would just block my view of the stars!
QuestText_Lilly_Story10_5_expansions_cop: I'm sure the spirits of nature here mean well for you.
QuestText_Lilly_boostProduction_copy: Even though it's not really necessary, you should still try and give mother nature a helping hand every once in a while.
QuestText_Lilly_construct_copy: A meadow is like a giant treasure trove of nature. All you have to do is help yourself!
QuestText_Lilly_harvest_3_harvest_copy: Isn't it beautiful when people appreciate nature's wonderful creations?
QuestText_Lilly_haveFlowershop_ownObject: It takes time to upgrade something, but doing so can give you lots of advantages. For instance, you can increase its capacity or unlock various items.
QuestText_Lilly_ownObject_copy: You'll be amazed to see what treasures the spirits of nature have waiting for you.
QuestText_Lilly_produce_copy: But remember: nature can't keep giving forever!
QuestText_Matilda_Story9_1_ownFarm_copy: Before that greedy Lester Crowley gets his hands on it...
QuestText_Matilda_Story9_2_nameFarm_copy: There's an old saying: "A good name is better than riches" - and it's probably true.
QuestText_Matilda_Story9_4_ownObject2_co: Hard work deserves a nice rest!
QuestText_Matilda_Story9_4_ownObject2_ti: Own 1 House on your gourmet farm
QuestText_Matilda_Story9_4_ownObject_tit: Have 1 Decoration on your gourmet farm
QuestText_Matilda_Story9_5_expansions_co: Give your plants the space they need!
QuestText_Matilda_boostProduction_copy: That should provide the growth spurt we need.
QuestText_Matilda_construct_copy: If everybody pitches in, it'll be done in no time.
QuestText_Matilda_harvestCash_copy: Roll up your sleeves: No pain, no gain.
QuestText_Matilda_ownObject_copy: Every farm should have one of these!
QuestText_Matilda_produce_copy: Isn't it lovely, harvesting the fruits of your own labor?
QuestText_MonicaAsian_ThemeAsian_3_harve: Cabbage goes really well with our rice dish. But will Daniel like it?
Together with rice, this is a nutritious, low calorie, and filling meal.
Growing rice is pretty tricky, but hopefully the surprise will turn out right!
QuestText_MonicaAsian_ThemeAsian_4_harve: These flowers will round off Daniel's surprise menu.
You can find cherry blossoms when collecting from the orchards on your main farm.
QuestText_OlegFish_desc: I fished for so many bass when I was younger that now I could catch them in my sleep!
QuestText_RitaFairytale_ThemeFairytale_1: Eggs are needed in almost every medieval recipe.
Roasted over the fire - a culinary delight.
QuestText_RitaFairytale_ThemeFairytale_6: Don't forget to make air holes in the jars!
You can find fireflies when harvesting and producing on your main farm.
QuestText_Rita_Story2_1_donate_copy: The flowers will decorate the tables, and the girls will braid them into their hair.
QuestText_Rita_Story2_1_produce_copy: When sowing seeds, do you make sure to have a good mix? The more colors, the better.
QuestText_Rita_Story2_3_donate1_copy: The kids will like that. And so will their parents, since kids don't usually eat fruit.
QuestText_Rita_Story2_3_donate2_copy: Yuck! Why does humus always have to smell like that? Why can't it smell like coffee?
QuestText_Rita_Story2_4_donate_copy: How much fat does your milk have? I really prefer low fat milk in my latte.
QuestText_Rita_Story3_4_donate_copy: Well, if you provide that amount, Bob is sure to be able to afford the best locks.
QuestText_Rita_Story4_1_harvest1_copy: When I was a kid, my Dad always told me, "An apple a day keeps the doctor away".
QuestText_Rita_Story4_1_harvest2_copy: Fresh milk is all very well and good, but I don't like it plain. I need the caffeine!
QuestText_Rita_Story5_2_donate_copy: It doesn't smell all that good ... I know why I surround myself with paper, printing ink, and Chanel.
QuestText_Rita_Story6_3_donate1_copy: I love it when a pie crust is crunchy, yet the apples inside are nice and soft.
QuestText_Rita_Story6_3_donate2_copy: Homemade dough is the foundation of any good pie.
QuestText_Rita_Story6_3_donate3_copy: Baking isn't for me. I make such a mess separating the yolk from the egg white. I'll leave that to the experts.
QuestText_Rita_Story8_1_harvest_copy: It's nice that the kids want to help, but make sure their fingers don't get too close to the blade!
QuestText_Rita_Story8_1_produce1_copy: That looks like real dirty work. I think I'll stay over here and take some pictures.
QuestText_Rita_Story8_1_produce2_copy: Oh, so that's how cow feed is made. Very interesting! I'll take another picture of it.
QuestText_Rita_boostProduction_copy: That gives your farm a touch of glamour.
QuestText_Rita_construct_copy: If you work hard, you'll be the talk of the town. I'll make sure of it.
QuestText_Rita_destroy_copy: If you're already making room, you might consider building a small coffeehouse.
QuestText_Rita_donatePellets_copy: It's pretty amazing, the stuff you find just lying around.
QuestText_Rita_donate_copy: You're doing the right thing. Just wait until I tell the mayor.
QuestText_Rita_earnCash_copy: I hope you're better with money than I am. It's just that I simply can't resist a chic pair of shoes!
QuestText_Rita_earnReputation_copy: A good reputation is not to be scoffed at. You never know who you're going to meet.
QuestText_Rita_expansions_copy: You really should expand. People are beginning to wonder why your farm isn't growing.
QuestText_Rita_harvestCash_copy: It's sensational how great the baked goods from your bakery are!
QuestText_Rita_harvest_copy: I'm always impressed when I meet people who still work "the real way" with their hands.
QuestText_Rita_joinAlliance_copy: I'm sure cooperatives are great for shooting the breeze.
QuestText_Rita_ownObject_copy: There are basic requirements you need to fulfill these days, you know.
QuestText_Rita_produce_copy: Did you know that Tessa has an incredibly productive farm?
QuestText_Rita_sellItem_copy: You should be careful you don't sell your goods for less than they're worth. Otherwise people will think you're in financial trouble.
QuestText_Rita_spendCash_copy: I think shopping is fabulous, although you probably spend your money on different things than I do.
QuestText_Rita_upgrade_copy: Pomp, splendor, and circumstance. If you carry on like that, your farm will be able to compete with Hollywood.
QuestText_Rita_useIngredient_copy: Feeding, fertilizing, sowing. Where would the farm be without you?
QuestText_TessaCamping_ThemeCamping_1_ha: Dry wood makes the best fire.
You can find firewood when harvesting the orchards on your main farm.
QuestText_TessaCamping_ThemeCamping_2_do: Baked apple and apple slices are easy to make with a campfire.
QuestText_TessaCamping_ThemeCamping_3_ha: You can find tracks when harvesting the fields on your main farm.
Keep your eyes open to find the culprit!
QuestText_TessaCamping_ThemeCamping_4_do: Young corn is crunchy and sweet. Our apple thief definitely won't be able to resist it...
Eggs will make excellent bait, since I'm pretty sure we're dealing with an animal that eats everything here!
QuestText_TessaCamping_ThemeCamping_5_ha: You can find map pieces when harvesting and producing on your main farm.
This way we're bound to find where our apple thief is hiding!
QuestText_TessaCamping_ThemeCamping_6_pr: This will definitely help them get through the winter.
One of these foods must be good bait.
If it tastes good to our pigs, it will definitely be a treat for bears.
QuestText_TessaFairytale_ThemeFairytale_: The trail will surely lead to the culprit…
You can find breadcrumbs when harvesting the fields and orchards on your main farm.
QuestText_Tessa_DecoTower1_1_decotower_c: Isn't this tower splendid? It's going to be great to see how it looks inside.
QuestText_Tessa_DecoTower1_1_unlockdecos: That's always what I find the most fun!
QuestText_Tessa_Story1_2_harvest_copy: Gosh, he's making a fuss ... just push the chickens off the eggs. They won't bite!
QuestText_Tessa_Story1_2_use_copy: What's he doing? You don't scatter the feed on the chickens, you scatter it in front of them!
QuestText_Tessa_Story2_1_donate_copy: I find pigs a bit too bristly, but the kids love these little pink creatures.
QuestText_Tessa_Story3_2_donate_copy: I think it goes without saying that you're not going to ask for any money for this. Looks like you've done your good deed for the day.
QuestText_Tessa_Story3_2_produce_copy: This feed will make those little pink creatures grow quickly, and also make a pretty profit.
QuestText_Tessa_Story4_4_donate_copy: Sacks of wheat can't be all that heavy. Don't make such a big deal out of carrying a few bags!
QuestText_Tessa_Story4_4_harvest_copy: I've harvested my share of wheat and taken it to the school already. You're not going to give up so close to the finish line, are you?
QuestText_Tessa_Story5_1_produce1_copy: I think it's so sweet how the little piglets rush to the trough. It reminds me of party guests at a buffet.
QuestText_Tessa_Story5_1_produce2_copy:
Your silo could do with some polishing; just think about all the dung that you put in it.
But what am I saying? Mine doesn't look any better.
QuestText_Tessa_Story6_2_donate1_copy: Lovely barbecue flavor with homemade garlic butter. The corn on the cob will taste delicious.
QuestText_Tessa_Story6_2_donate2_copy: Some people don't like coleslaw. But if you add some carrots and a good dressing, it tastes fantastic!
QuestText_Tessa_Story6_2_donate3_copy: We should bake fresh white bread ourselves. It will go perfectly with the fish or the salad.
QuestText_Tessa_Story6_3_donate2_copy: Of course we need apples for the apple pie. But no raisins please! There are people who add those little black things to everything.
QuestText_Tessa_Story6_4_donate_copy: Just a little more work, and we'll have wonderful table arrangements.
QuestText_Tessa_Story6_4_harvest_copy: The wildflowers should be fresh from the meadow, so that they can fill the room with their scent.
QuestText_Tessa_Story7_1_donate_copy: I'll send you my workers to make sure I get the milk as fresh as possible.
QuestText_Tessa_Story7_1_harvest_copy: If your workers are gentle with the cows, the milk will stay fresh longer.
QuestText_Tessa_Story7_4_harvest_copy: Cooking and baking aren't really my thing, but my cherry cakes are pretty darn good.
QuestText_Tessa_Story8_2_use1_copy: Don't worry, the chickens won't hurt you. And take care not to step on any eggs!
QuestText_Tessa_Story8_2_use2_copy: The pigs can smell the feed already. Just drop it and come to the fence!
QuestText_Tessa_Story8_2_use3_copy: No need to be timid feeding the cows. Oh, don't make such a fuss, it's just cow slobber.
QuestText_Tessa_assignWorkers_copy: Rubber boots are essential wear for all workers. You never know what you might step in.
QuestText_Tessa_boostProduction_copy: You should definitely reward your workers for the extra effort.
QuestText_Tessa_buyItem_copy: I bought some once, too. It cost me an arm and a leg!
QuestText_Tessa_construct_copy: Did you like playing with building blocks when you were a kid, too?
QuestText_Tessa_destroy_copy: For me, demolishing something is more like cleaning up.
QuestText_Tessa_donate_copy: Working with other people always makes me feel really good. Don't you feel the same?
QuestText_Tessa_earnCash_copy: Earn to reinvest. Only in the right things, of course.
QuestText_Tessa_earnReputation_copy: A little friendly competition between neighbors keeps the friendship alive and promotes the economy.
QuestText_Tessa_harvestCash_copy: You could use some of that to buy something nice to decorate your farm.
QuestText_Tessa_harvest_copy: If your workers are happy, the produce will basically collect itself.
QuestText_Tessa_ownObject_copy: It's definitely necessary. Look at how much Lester has already built!
QuestText_Tessa_produce_copy: Producing, cooking, working. There's always something to do.
QuestText_Tessa_spendCash_copy: Decorations make your workers happy and are always a worthwhile investment.
QuestText_Tessa_sumHappiness_copy: Which decorations make your workers happiest? Find out here!
QuestText_Tessa_upgrade_copy: There are lots of benefits to upgrading. You either make room for new workers, or you make new jobs. Sounds great, doesn't it?
QuestText_Tessa_useChickenfeed_useIngred: Once you finish this task, there's a reward waiting for you!
QuestText_Tessa_useIngredient_copy: It is important in this case to tell your workers exactly what they need to do.
QuestText_Vicky_Pet1_1_ownObject_doghous: As luck would have it, I found a blueprint for a doghouse in my attic. How convenient!
Build a doghouse on your main farm.
QuestText_Vicky_Pet1_2_namePet_copy: Dog trainers recommend short and catchy names.
QuestText_Vicky_Pet1_2_namePet_help: Click on your doghouse or select "Show me!" to name your dog.
QuestText_Vicky_Pet1_3_feedPet_copy: You'd better teach him right away that chicks and frogs aren't on the menu.
QuestText_Vicky_Pet1_3_feedPet_help: Simply click on the doghouse to feed your dog when it's sad.
QuestText_Vicky_Pet1_3_petStatus_copy: You should always take good care of your dog.
QuestText_Vicky_Pet1_3_petStatus_help: The status menu is one of the options available when you click on your doghouse.
QuestText_Vicky_Pet1_4_ownObject_copy: We can start right away. I brought some tools and boards from my farm.
QuestText_assignWorkers_help: You get free workers by building houses. However, keep in mind that houses reduce happiness and therefore increase your production costs.
QuestText_boostProduction_help: If you perform this action, your production will be increased and improved.
QuestText_buyItem_help: If you don't have enough dollars for your shopping, sell your produce in the farm management panel.
QuestText_collect_allianceTree_help: Once your tree has been sufficiently watered, you can collect a small reward from it. The more watering it needs, the bigger your reward will be.
QuestText_construct_help: Building objects takes time and occupies the building slot. You can pay gold to skip the building step at any time.
QuestText_destroy_help: Demolishing objects has its advantages. You get dollars, and your workers are free to do other tasks. But demolishing something also occupies the building slot.
QuestText_donatePellets_help: You can find an overview of your collectibles in your inventory. Move the cursor over the boxes to see where they can be found.
QuestText_donatePellets_title: Add a collectible to a collection
QuestText_donate_help: Click on Supply to make the appropriate goods available. Be aware that once you have donated goods, you will no longer be able to take them back.
QuestText_earnCash_help: The farm management panel is your main source of income. This is where you sell your harvest and any goods you produce.
QuestText_earnReputation_help: To earn reputation points you must do missions. The size of the group and your position in the group determine your reward at the end of the mission.
QuestText_expansions_help:
To expand your farm, click on a piece of land adjacent to your farm.
It costs a certain amount of dollars depending on your level. You can buy land sooner by paying gold instead.
QuestText_finishMissions_help: Play missions and collect the most farm products. You'll earn reputation points for your activity and move up in the rankings. There's nothing to lose from playing missions, only reputation points to win!
QuestText_flowerfarm_harvest_3_title: Collect earnings from {0} in the shop
QuestText_flowerfarm_nameFarm_title: Give your flower farm a name
QuestText_flowerfarm_sumHappiness_title: Achieve a happiness of {amount} on your flower farm
